org.fluidity.foundation

Interface Log<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - identifies the class to which a component instance implementing the Log interface belongs.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LogAdapter

    public interface Log<T>
    Log interface to use by dependency injected components. An instance is provided to your component via dependency injection. You must use a parameterized reference as the dependency on this interface to specify the class that will be the name of the injected logger.

    Message formatting conforms to the Java print format specification.

    The injected instance will be backed by an actual logging framework; which one is used depends on the LogFactory found in the class path. Fluid Tools implements adapters for popular frameworks; see the User Guide for details. If no specific logging framework is configured, the default one will be used that forwards all log messages to the standard output stream.

    Log Levels

    Log levels are queried from the underlying logging framework and cached. Invoke LogLevels.updated() to trigger reloading the log level permissions.

    Usage

     @Component
 public final class MyComponent {

   private final Log log;

   MyComponent(final Log<MyComponent> log) {
     this.log = log;
   }

   public void someMethod() {
     log.info("so it has come to this");
     …
   }
 }

    • Method Detail

      • isTraceEnabled

        boolean isTraceEnabled()
        Tells if TRACE level messages will be emitted or not.
        Returns:
        true if TRACE level messages will be emitted, false if not.
